website_summaries.verdict: A straightforward plug and play pair of computer speakers that deliver the rich sound that you should expect from Bose at a relatively affordable price.
pros: Top-tier Bose quality and distortion-free audio
Auxiliary input can connect a second device
cons: If you don’t appreciate the simplicity of wired connectivity, look elsewhere for Wi-Fi or Bluetooth computer speakers

customer_reviews.title: Flat sound, no bass
customer_reviews.text: I received these and anxiously unboxed them and plugged them in to replace an old semi-blown pair of speakers I have at my desk. I was immediately dissapointed by the lack of highs and lows. These speakers deliver an abysmal mid-heavy flat sound that is not worth the price tag. I can't believe this is a BOSE product. I returned them immediately and purchased a set of M-Audio AV-42's instead.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Shephard

customer_reviews.title: Bose is not the Bose we knew. Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. I paid two almost three times as much for Bose, because of their reputation. These speakers are a sham, a bait and switch at best. The material quality and the sound are substantially less quality than the two no name speakers we have here for a third of the money. $39 and you could get Bluetooth with another brand. I am never buying Bose and am a bit put off my Amazon shopping.
customer_reviews.author: Lochfynne

customer_reviews.title: Funtionally useless
customer_reviews.text: Maybe if I was rocking out to rap music in my car on Friday night I'd enjoy the overpowering base but in my office? This is useless. Base overpowers whole system. Additionally at about half volume it starts to break up and get static. Material quality and durability become pointless if you can't use the darn thing. And the packaging.... overpackage much? yes. yes they do. Shocking considering the name and price of these speakers. I find most of these reviews hard to understand considering my experience
customer_reviews.author: William Crawford

customer_reviews.title: These speakers are incredible
customer_reviews.text: Considering the small size, and the fact that there is no separate subwoofer, the sound coming from these speakers is very impressive. They blow away others I have from a different brand, that do have a separate subwoofer. My other speakers sound muddy compared to the richness and clarity of these Bose speakers. I never expected to experience so much bass from these little speakers. Understandably, they don't have the same intense bass as a Bose surround system, but then that isn't a fair comparison. These speakers aren't inexpensive, but when you consider the quality and amazing sound, I think the price is reasonable. In this case, you really do get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Nomer

customer_reviews.title: I love these speakers
customer_reviews.text: Booming! I am enjoying the speakers. I don't like to write reviews but I appreciate them when others provide them. I live in a small condo, so I need speakers that are small and carry crisp clear sound. These speakers are great for what I need and like to enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: I listen to a lot of music on my PC. I expected some depth & a good sound stage. Also I wanted crisp highs. Not with this set. But they are very nice to listen to casually. If you're a classical music lover, Pavarotti, and sopranos, don't expect a thrilling experience. But all in all they are quite good. If you want all of the above, you'll have to spend a lot more (over $200). If you have a deep wallet, try the Bose 301-V 29309 Stereo Loudspeakers. I have these on my Home Theater (5*). I've used these for the past few months. I love them more. For under $150, these are the best.
customer_reviews.author: vrystaat

customer_reviews.title: Worst speakers for 100.00
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my logitech 5.1 surround sound system for these and I have got to say for being Bose I'm super disappointed. They sound like acoustic speakers. I have a better speaker in my monitor than these put out. I even used an equalizer to boost the sound, and they still sound like crap. If you can don't buy these waste its of a 100.00.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny N.

customer_reviews.title: Very Short Audio Wire Provided...
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding Bose quality sound as expected including full volume! But was disappointed with the very short audio cable provided that was ~3 ft... Some of us old timers have actual computers with computer desks and need to run audio longer to have speakers on top of our desks (and computer below)... Had to order a separate male to male audio cable that was longer....
customer_reviews.author: oldsoul

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up for TV, front sound finally!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We are senior's and needed some front sound for my hard of hearing hubby, TV speakers are in the back and can only go 100% from the TV, which is BAD because the bedroom is on other side of the wall. I am pretty knowledgeable but couldn't put in a sound bar for the life of me. This works PERFECT!!! Took less than 5 mins Nothing to download onto your phone, just get up from your chair and turn the sound dial. Now the TV sound is Off and we only use these front speakers. Dial is set low too!!!! No static just nice sound. Greatest thing ever!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: 2 Ragdoll Cats

customer_reviews.title: ANYONE LOOKING TO BUY THESE SPEAKERS HAS TO READ THIS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Please read this before purchasing these Bose!!! The power cord is crazy SHORT! I cannot hook these up because of the short cord! The cord going to your computer to speaker is really CRAZY short! Could not come even close to connecting. The cord from left to right speaker is crazy long. I really dont know who they were targeting these speakers....I hooked them up on my counter and used an ipod for music.....well music came out but highs...horrible.... bass .... not much there. There are much better choices than these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: phototgguy

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected bad sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Unexpected bad sound quality. Only middle bass frequencies. Sound is like from a tube. Each speaker contains just of one small paper speaker. No tweeters, etc. I overpaid thrice.
customer_reviews.author: John Der

customer_reviews.title: Just ok.  Nothing great.
customer_reviews.text: While the sound is "loud enough" - I would like them to get louder. The quality of sound is average. When you put it on the highest volume, it gets a bit muffled. I wish they made the speakers smaller/more compact. The speakers were lighter than I thought they would be. The look of them is ok. Nothing fancy but nothing obnoxious. Unpacking the item is pretty easy and setting it up is easy and straight forward. I've read people complainta that there is not enough bass... but I thought it was fine. I use the speakers with my MAC laptop which I keep on my living room table. It's fine for watching youtube, listening to music, etc.
customer_reviews.author: BottomLine

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat disappointed in the sound.
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved Bose stuff. I've used their professional speakers and home speakers. The reviews on these seem to be high, but I have to tell you, I don't think these are up to Bose standards. Maybe its just the set I got, but the sound is muddy and bassy. There is almost no high end with clarity. I am pretty disappointed, actually. The build quality is good, although these could use a power-on light, so someone would know they were on. I like having the headphone jack in the front and accessible. They seem solid. I'm just quite disappointed in the sound, which is what speakers are supposed to make. Probably won't use these long.
customer_reviews.author: B A Farnsworth

customer_reviews.title: Bose
customer_reviews.text: I own 2 sets of Bose AM 5, a set of Bose AM 3, Bose AM 6 and two Bose book shelves loudspeakers. Coming from loudspeakers and suddenly shift to multi media speaker for the first time is really bad. Now time to test if it can perform the speakers I have patronized since 1995. I went on Youtube and search for HD sounds and listened to ELO, Kim Carnes "Bette Davis eyes" but sound quality are bad. Finally found Reo Speedwagon "keep on lovin" HD audio and it was perfect! This speaker produce clean open sound. An air mass Bose quality similar to their acoustimass. This is descent computer speakers for the price.
customer_reviews.author: BongCoy

customer_reviews.title: Mehhh performance way below typical Bose sound
customer_reviews.text: Short and sweat. These are a middling pair of speakers. Nothing impressive on any end..not highs...minds and the bass is muted and distant. Seriously you could get the same sound from a set at $60 or less. There is zero Bose typical sound quality to them at all. Either everyone who gives them 5 stars has no basic understanding of what a decent Bose speaker should sound like or they are sucking for ratings...I go for the later. If you are into overspending for mehhhhh sound go for it otherwise move it along Betty
customer_reviews.author: Shughey

customer_reviews.title: WOW BOSE WHAT UP WITH THIS ?
customer_reviews.text: This was such a disappointment. I got it all set up in and it sounded like a tin can. $100 no way maybe $15. So I sent it back and got a Soundtouch 10 from Bose direct from their website it was refurbished but still has the one year warranty $200.00 It sounds great and also has a great base sound good for gaming and music. You can also stream to it via phone or other devices and it comes with a remote as well I got a 10 ft. cord to plug in the speakers to my computer from amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Tampa Man

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely blown away!!
customer_reviews.text: Replacing a Harman Kardon with sub-woofer....an real old school workhorse. Really worried about not having that sub-woofer experience. Fear no more!!! This little pair of beauties just BLEW ME AWAY!!! The videos here in the reviews were a crucial part of the decision-making process for me. Very grateful for the excellent examples....and so happy I followed the path to this purchase. Easily said good-bye to that woofer.....no regrets! (and I have a history of being really hard on speakers...have blown my share) There is no way I can get to the top of these little masters. Bose, you have once more delivered incredible value! To anyone considering these, prepare to be VERY HAPPY!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Serfass doTERRA Wellness Advocate

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is excellent........at any level of volume for computer speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Sound is very important to me. There is no distortion at any level. The sound is superb for computer speakers. The bass, treble, and mid tones are all there. If you desire more sound and volume, you need to move up to a sound system. The Bose Companion 2 Series III system can be clearly heard thru several rooms in our home.....Clearly! I along with several thousand reviews give this system a 5 star rating for that reason. I love the addition of a jack for earphones in the front of the right speaker. The control for volume is very good and the system is well made.
customer_reviews.author: sultanaman

customer_reviews.title: DECENT BUT NOT WORTH THE PRICE
customer_reviews.text: I agree with many previous reviewers. This set of Bose speakers are decent, but not great (as you'd expect from Bose). The overall sound is decent but nothing more. Base is minimal. Because they are Bose, everyone should expect more. Don't get me wrong, they aren't terrible, but for $99.99 we expect more. The volume knob doesn't have a light to alert it's on which is strange. The sound range is ok...but, again....beating the drum again....this is Bose and we should get more. I'm glad I didn't buy a set of cheap speakers because they certainly wouldn't cut the mustard.
customer_reviews.author: PATHRCO

customer_reviews.title: I didn't think there was such a thing as too much bass, but...
customer_reviews.text: Nice sound, but I expect a little more at this price point. I can see how some other reviewers say that there is too much bass. (That's like saying "too much chocolate," right?) But they have a point. I like bass too, and that's one reason I bought these speakers, but it's almost as if the bass is artificially boosted inordinately in these speakers, and.... there's no way to turn it down. C'mon, Bose, how about a simple knob to adjust how much bass we want? These speakers are like a lot of other tinny computer speakers out there, coupled with a big subwoofer that you can't turn down.
customer_reviews.author: J. English

customer_reviews.title: Bose Companion 2 Series III Speakers -- HELP NEEDED! NO SOUND!
customer_reviews.text: I received this set of speakers and assumed it would be plug & play and done. This was not the case. I receive no sound except a something that indicates it's they're trying to work. Done extensive research on the web and can't find a solution. I have a feeling a Win 10 update is related to this issue, but not sure. Anyone have this issue? I'm so frustrated and too time-consuming to figure this out. I gave this one star but will be happy to change that if I can get these to work and see if they are as great as everyone here says they are.
customer_reviews.author: Jill S.

customer_reviews.title: doesn't fit into the output space on my desk top Mac
customer_reviews.text: I suspect I do not know enough about computers to buy the right thing. That said, when the description says compatible with Mac, it seems it might mention that I won't be able to plug it into my Mac. In retrospect I suspect that is what is indicated by 3.5 mm aux. Though that meant nothing to me before. Have not yet decided whether to send them back without trying them or figure out how to use an adapter of some sort. It's very frustrating to be old and try to do something nice for someone and have it just create more problems and disappointment. No more gift electronics for or from me.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah A Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: Reliability big problem, Amazon to the rescue
customer_reviews.text: I previously wrote a four star review praising the speakers except for the overemphasized bass. Unfortunately after two weeks the set conked out. Since that was also the fate of my previous Yamaha NX-50 purchase, I took another chance with Bose. Amazon quickly replaced it at no cost to me. So far so good, but I'm holding my breath. Going through the many hours of burn-in is also a pain. Gone are the days when the Harman Kardon that came with a Dell desktop sounded gorgeous and lasted many years
customer_reviews.author: chinpoko

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic speakers. For music or sound professionals these don't ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic speakers. For music or sound professionals these don't have all of the features such as a subwoofer, but I think for most people I think these would work really well. I had never purchased Bose before because they are expensive, but I felt like I got a great deal on these for my first Bose item. The sound works great and is still clear and crisp at high volumes. The only things I would suggest is a light to indicate that the power is on and also the indicator for where the volume is could be clearer (right now it's just a black notch in the knob that is hard to see).
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Shame on Bose for skimping on cords!
customer_reviews.text: Sound is great, size is perfect. BUT.... dear BOSE...not everybody places their computer on the right side of their desk; not everybody puts their speakers on their desktop, and not all . Not only was the cable between the computer and speaker too short at something like 25", but the power cord couldn't reach any outlet or power strip unless it was less than 3' away. What's wrong with you guys? Very disappointed that I had to go purchase extra stuff to make the speakers functional. Somebody grab the design department and give them a good shake. The speakers otherwise are great.
customer_reviews.author: CherokeeSmiles

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers, short cables...
customer_reviews.text: Just got these speakers for a new Dell PC system. They sound great. ONLY complaint is the (fixed) left speaker wire (that plugs into the right speaker is TOO SHORT !!! Come on BOSE, I have a 5' wide business desk and the speakers barely fit. Would it of killed your profit margin to make this wire a foot or two longer? Great sounding speakers can be place a little wider apart to fill the room with sound. At LEAST offer a jumper or extension cable. The speakers do sound great though.
customer_reviews.author: Pabco

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: BOSE really provides an audible experience. The brand really has proven its reputation. I went from a 15$ cheap set of logitech speakers to these bad boys. The 100$ was well worth it. The bass is prominent and clarity is so crisp and superior sounding for these semi small speakers. They pack a punch. For Audiophiles like myself, you'll want these for a desktop setup. You will not be disappointed. Im currently on my way to a noise citation in my apartment complex. Wish me luck :D
customer_reviews.author: Amandathebold

customer_reviews.title: Great for Apt or Office
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good general multi-purpose speaker. It's a big improvement over the built in television speakers which sound awful. Bought these for my roommate after I was tired of hearing the volume fluctuate in the living room. could barely hear the dialogue but then gunshots would sound like they were right in your living room. Did a great job smoothing out music and dialogue. Not going to get a lots of bass but it's certainly enough to create a full sound for a small to medium sized room. Ideal for an apartment or office.
customer_reviews.author: Grey Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Nice desktop Speakers
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the sound is good. Have to remember; you're not buying a home sound system. Or for that matter or set with a powered sub. All that being said, the volume is more than adequate and the quality of the sound/music is good. I would recommend them to anyone for a set of desktop speakers. I listen to some music and occasionally watch a movie on the computer and these fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Arioc

customer_reviews.title: PRODUCT FAILED RIGHT AFTER THE RETURN WINDOW CLOSED/DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: The sound was great for a few weeks. The speakers no longer work, when plugged in there is no sound or any sign of power. The return window closed on Oct. 18th, it is now Oct 20th and I bought them for my birthday party on Oct22 to watch movies in stereo. I am very disappointed. At the cost of $100.00 I would think there would be some type of warranty or return policy if the product fails. I love bose speakers and these did have a great stereo sound, but, did not last.
customer_reviews.author: Mngarden

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great speakers.
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a good pair of speakers for your computer these will do a good job. I am not sure why they have not heeded all of the notes that talk about the very short cord (3.5 mm audio cable) to hook them up to your computer (3 ft.). Count on buying a longer cord and order it when you buy the speakers. It's incredible that the Bose product team couldn't see that the cord included would be too short for the vast majority of users. I don't know what you can do with original audio cable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value, pair with listed Subwoofer for a quality Sound setup for your PC!
customer_reviews.text: Bose speakers for $100, I mean. BUY THE DERN THINGS. Don't expect cinema-quality audio from ANY computer speaker. It isn't a thing. And if it is, it's too darn expensive and not worth it. These things have a great sound, and good volume. I coupled it with a Polk Audio subwoofer (available on Amazon, also for under $100) and, PRESTO. A wonderful sound experience for your computer for around $200 dollars. Make sure to buy the appropriate cabling to hook it all up to your PC.
customer_reviews.author: Marcovich

customer_reviews.title: LOUSY sound
customer_reviews.text: I used these on my desktop computer and they are very poor sounding. There is no adjustment for bass or treble and it is difficult to get a nice sounding reproduction or stereo separation of the music., and I am a big fan of BOSE products. So, at a price of $100.00., you can do a lot better and a lot cheaper. Bose may last longer., I don't know but we will see, in the meantime they are relegated to my closet...
customer_reviews.author: E. Spadafora

customer_reviews.title: Great PC speakers
customer_reviews.text: The speakers sounded very bad when I first turned them on. Hollow, empty sound. I have a new HP TG01 that did not have its sound options where I expected them. Once found, I played with the frequency response and ended up with some very fine sounding speakers that I'm content with. I would certainly recommend these and buy them again. If you want a powerful, major bass sound system, then you need to spend several hundred dollars more. The small Bose are just not going to do it. My only complaint is the point of manufacture. I would've paid more for the same speakers if they were made in the USA or anywhere else but the point of manufacture.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Culver

customer_reviews.title: They're computer speakers...
customer_reviews.text: Bose makes decent stuff, and these no exception - but it's not house speaker system. When you plant them on your desk 24" from your head, you won't need them loud to sound good. I'll crank them up a little to listen to music sometimes when I'm close to the office, and they sound good, but don't expect to rattle windows with clarity. I'm happy with them, just don't expect magic when you didn't spend more money...
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Overrated
customer_reviews.text: I have to say, I expected better from these speakers. They don't sound bad, but I have had cheap speakers sound the same if not better. Coming from Bose, I was expecting a deeper bass than what these offer. These sound just like any other average computer speakers. I analyzed the spectrum response and it seems quite even across the spectrum with a slight emphasis on the lower end between 70Hz and 150Hz, but then it quickly drops off once you go below 70Hz. Moving above 150Hz they slightly drop off until about 300Hz and then remain more stable until about 20,000Hz. I've seen Bose products smaller than these speakers produce a better, deeper bass than these.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: All the good reviews Oh well
customer_reviews.text: Was expecting quite a bit more performance and sound quality when; 1. Coming from Bose, 2. Price point ($100!?), 3. All the good reviews Oh well. I've got my living room stereo for my room shaking audio, but still quite a bit disappointed in this $100 pair of speakers that acts pretty much like a $40 pair. I'm going to keep them, but I wanted to voice my opinion, and i RARELY leave product reviews. But this deserved it.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: These are the BOMB!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, am I ever glad my other desktop speakers took a dive. The Bose speakers were recommended to me by someone I know who is also very impressed with the quality and sound of the speakers. I have no idea how loudly they will play without distortion, enough to rattle the windows for sure. For desktop computer use, these are the most impressive speakers I've ever heard. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Zap

customer_reviews.title: Heed the Instructions: 75% Max Volume from Sources
customer_reviews.text: Just received these and hooked them up to my iMac. Immediately, sound would completely drop out randomly and then come back. The Quick Start and Troubleshooting instructions clearly state to set the volume on your computer AND on your source application (i.e. iTunes) to 75%. That means set it and forget it at 75% and control all volume thereafter via the volume knob on the Bose speaker. I'd give these a higher rating, but I just received them, haven't lived with them long and the sound drop issue was annoying upon installation. I've not had that issue with other computer speakers. Bose appears to have put a virtual fuse or limiter in-line to protect the speakers.
customer_reviews.author: TruDat

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice Sound
customer_reviews.text: I had a lightening strike and fortunately for me, all that got fried was my 15 year old set of cheap speakers that I had hooked up to my PC. So, I upgraded to these Bose Speakers. Never thought that I would say that I would be glad to have a power surge destroy a part of my electronics, but this has proved to be the exception. Great sound, from fairly small speakers. Easy install with no issues. All told, a really nice sound for a reasonable price. If you are considering an upgrade to the sound quality that your computer delivers, I recommend these Bose speakers. Worth the $$$.
customer_reviews.author: Felix C Batton

customer_reviews.title: Bass is Boomy and Muddled
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these because we had a great experience with the Series 1. These have an overpowering boom to the bass - not like the Legion of Boom, but more like a CIA torture technique. That is, if the CIA endorsed torture. I tried to tune it out by turning the bass all the way down and cranking the treble on our TV, which was the intended host. Nothing helped. So, I figured they'd be good on my desk with my PC, but same thing with music. Annoying muddy bass ruined music. Music that should sound awesome with great bass. Not with these. Went back to the $25 Logitech's. I plan to donate this pair to the CIA.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Clemens

customer_reviews.title: Can always count on Bose quality
customer_reviews.text: I just got a new desktop and needed to get speakers. Came across these when searching. I didn't want to get anything too small and have poor sound quality but I didn't want anything too big either. These fit just fine on each side of my 27" monitor. Sound quality is as you can expect from Bose. Def a lot better when I'm listening to music while editing. Just have to remember not to turn the volume up too much.
customer_reviews.author: JFD

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to give these 5-stars because 4.5 stars isn't an option and there's room for improvement in almost everything, not only from a function/performance standpoint, but also a price-point. I like the form-factor, the price, the sound, and the installation. These on a MacBook, had a moment of concern as the volume was so low, but checked the audio preferences and made some adjustments to the volume and voila. Well-balanced without any audio element overriding another. Great imaging for their size and placement, I am occasionally shocked at the channel separation, just how good it is at close range and with about 14" physical separation. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Bremer

customer_reviews.title: Unobtrusive and a great value!
customer_reviews.text: This pair of speakers sits on my office desk at home. They're compact and unobtrusive. The sound is excellent. The whole room fills up. I was looking for something with a subwoofer so I compromised when trying this set, but the bass is terrific (at least for my non-audiophile ear). Music, talk, sports all sound clear and deep. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: P. Browning

customer_reviews.title: Another problem solved
customer_reviews.text: I've been teaching music online for six months now, and have decided to adapt to the 'new normal' and get better equipment, as I think I'll be doing this for awhile. I couldn't stand listening to the sound of a violin, or even people's voices, over the onboard speakers on my MacBook Pro for 6 hours at a stretch, and finally decided to fix it. These are an inexpensive fix; not top-end, but certainly quite suitable for 90% of the situations where one might need external speakers for a laptop. They are small, easy to set up, and easy to use. No complaints. Life is better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer in Raleigh, NC

customer_reviews.title: too much bass, not enough treble.  hard hearing voices
customer_reviews.text: I was highly disappointed in these considering the premium price. While the bass is powerful, you cannot hear voices/people talking unless you really up the volume. And then the bass will blow you out of the room and not in a good way. Tried adjusting with various software, but still doesn't alleviate the problem. Might be OK for solo gaming, but just bad bad bad for watching youtube and twitch.
customer_reviews.author: Shane D. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Very good sound, well constructed
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure what to expect with these being about the least expensive thing Bose sells but I'm pleasantly surprised. They have that crisp clarity that Bose is known for. We have several different Bose portable bluetooth speakers and those all seem to be a bit muddy. Happy to say these are very crisp. Perfect for the computer desk. I'm in a condo so need something that sounds good at lower volumes and these have a lot of definition. Glad a spent a few extra bucks and went with these. Another plus is these are completely black and just kind of disappear on your desk - also, no distracting LED power light which I'm grateful Bose saw fit not to include.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Built My Hotrod

customer_reviews.title: Very good computer speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound quality - love the tactile feel of the volume knob on the front of the right speaker - feels very high quality when you adjust the volume up and down. Way better than a set of Logitech or similar speakers doing the same. Not a ton of bass - which is kind of to be expected for "computer speakers" without a dedicated subwoofer unit - but if you're sitting at a desktop computer you might not necessarily want max bass (and if you really want that - go for something else like full-on studio monitors, or a setup with a dedicated subwoofer).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I always knew Bose made the best speakers but I was looking for speakers less than ...
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are phenominal. I have a high performance gaming pc and was looking for speakers to replace my Astro gaming headset. I always knew Bose made the best speakers but I was looking for speakers less than 100 dollars and I spotted these. If you are looking for speakers that cost 100 dollars or less then do yourself a favor and purchase these. The sound is absolutely incredible especially for pc games like Call of Duty. The sound effects sound rich and vibrant and not at all tinny. I am extremely happy with my purchase and would 100% recommend these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a very happy consumer
customer_reviews.text: I had a Bose speaker set for my PC which I bought about 10 years ago, but needed to replace it since it gave out. However, I'm having problems connecting the new speakers to my PC, so it's just sitting on my desk, and I don't have any sound coming from the PC. Oh, well...just goes to show me that I shouldn't order such things through Amazon again. The next time I need to replace electrical components, I'll just go to Costco...they give fabulous service AND warranty on the electrical stuff (PC's, TVs, appliances, etc.) that they sell. Lesson learned!
customer_reviews.author: Nekochan

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are outstanding. The overall sound quality is incredible. Everything is crisp and clear and you can hear every nuance in your music. The bass is good with a nice balance to the overall sound. If you LOVE bass, then you might want to get something that has a separate sub-woofer. I highly recommend these speakers for those that want crisp clean sound from quality speakers at an acceptable price.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel W Knight

customer_reviews.title: They should have never put their name on these speakers
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are very bad. It sounds like someone put a plastic cup on top of a Bluetooth speaker. I already have very low expectations with any Bose product priced at less than $250 and even still I was surprised by the poor, hollow and cheap sound. I have a $30 pair of computer speakers that are several times better in quality and depth.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It's a Bose!
customer_reviews.text: While these are not subwoofers, and will not shake the room like a pair of 12" towers or subs, they sound very well balanced, have awesome depth, width, and a very natural sound. These seem to be the same drivers as the Wave stereos, but for $300 less, this is a no brainer! I can't believe these just replaced my two Pioneer 12's and Magnavox receiver. I am hearing depth that I wasn't hearing before! I use a Soundblaster Play 2 USB sound card and leave the EQ flat, but I boost the overall level fader so it acts like a preamp and let the Bose do its thing. It works very well!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing performance for a Bose product
customer_reviews.text: I just connected the speakers to my laptop and I am extremely disappointed. I hear a rattling distortion sound periodically even at low levels. I double checked the audio cables were snug in both my laptop audio out jack and the audio in jack on the speakers. I will be returning these speakers for a refund. I had a older model of these same computer speakers years ago, and unfortunately they were stolen from my home. The sound quality was superior to the sound of these speakers, and I also believe they has treble and bass knobs. Now I have to go through the hassle of returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Callahan

customer_reviews.title: Decent Sound
customer_reviews.text: These speakers work great for my desktop computer. I put them on their sides underneath the monitor so they act like a "sound bar". They have good sound. If you want even more sound depth, get a system with a subwoofer. But for the price, these are really great and do not sound cheap or scratchy.
customer_reviews.author: TippySkippy

customer_reviews.title: Great design for computer/desktop use
customer_reviews.text: These are great for using with a PC or Mac in a desktop configuration: - They are angled up to your ears. - They sound is great, even base. Very clear with limited excess noise as with other speakers. - They have great sound separation, I didn't notice this in the prior speakers. - The large volume knob up-front on the right speaker makes it really easy to adjust volume. - Also the right speaker has a Jack right in front for headphones so you don't need to disconnect the speakers from the PC/Mac. - There is another jack in the back for a second device input. - They look great. These were really worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer 21

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding desktop speakers
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say here: these aren’t high end bookshelf speakers but are waaaay better than any USB powered speakers I’ve ever heard - there is actually some bass. I love having a real volume knob and a headphone jack on the front if needed. Sound quality is great for my needs, which is work and a little music via Spotify (conference calls sound much better!)
customer_reviews.author: El Duderino

customer_reviews.title: tinny
customer_reviews.text: i read all the reviews and still bought them.i wanted to upgrade my 10yr. old logitechs. i thought by spending more money i could get a better sound,nope nooo bass. as soon as i tried them i ordered a new $48 set of logitechs. after testing on several computers hands down for the money you can't do any better,As for the bose, you have to destroy the packaging to open,so how do you send them back??wife is mad at me so I just turn up my new logies.maybe a yard sale item,if I lie I can dump them.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: No Bas or Treble controls
customer_reviews.text: I love Bose product, but not this one. It does not have the bass tone I'm looking for. No bass control and to treble control, only volume up and down. I would've paid more money for one with more bass
customer_reviews.author: Robert Manning

customer_reviews.title: They're ok
customer_reviews.text: They're ok, I was expecting a little more from Bose, to be honest. I'm a Bose nut, most of my speakers are from them. These are decent, but have little bass, and an overall odd sound. The cheap old dell speakers these replaced actually sounded better. I'm contemplating sending them back; most any computer speakers you'll find will sound comparable. I should have known better, I usually avoid the lowest end Bose products, as the mid and higher end products sound much better in my experience.
customer_reviews.author: dcamnc

customer_reviews.title: Sound 'muddy'. Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for these, seeing as how they were mid-priced at $99. Total disappointment. They sound worse than speakers costing less than half as much. I didn't expect them to be fantastic for one hundred bucks, but they should at least sound decent. These are going right back in the box to be returned. So glad they have the "free returns" offer on them.
customer_reviews.author: Jack  B. Nimble

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: I got a new HP computer that has Windows 10 and I love it. Here comes the BUT: but the sound isn,t good for using Skype so I bought these speakers. What a profound difference they make, every word is crystal clear. They are pricey ($100.00) but to me they are priceless for keeping in touch with family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: DebbieL.

customer_reviews.title: Never buy from this company.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely NEVER buy from this company: Express Electronics. I was six days late in asking for a return of Bose Speakers and they refused to allow me to return it. The Bose speakers have absolutely NO bass sound and very little ability to increase column. It's all treble and very tinny sounding, despite the immense cost and the arguably positive reputation. VERY OVERRATED speakers! The company refused to accept the return and thus I had to keep the speakers and try to sell them on Craigslist! Never again! Amazon also refused to get involved and just washed their hands of the problem. Would not consider a refund. Won't buy from Amazon again!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Michelson

customer_reviews.title: I'm a big fan of Bose so the first thing ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of Bose so the first thing I'll say is "if it's a Bose it's gotta be good", I expected quality & I have it! I have a 22" Samsung TV with decent speakers, but I plug in these speakers & I have top notch stereo, certainly worth the $100 I'll add this for you older folk, I don't hear as well as I used to & I miss a lot of what's said with the TV speakers, these Bose speakers adds clarity for me & I can hear everything said. It's not about the volume as much as the clarity.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Kenopke

customer_reviews.title: Cheap speakers with an expensive name
customer_reviews.text: For $100 you're buying $20 worth of speakers and $80 of brand recognition. They're not bad. The volume knob works, they don't take up too much space, and sound comes out. High notes are tinny and bass is flat, but hey, they do the job adequately enough if you don't really care about that kinda thing. Y'know those piles of PC speakers with tangled cables you see sitting in thrift stores? Or those no-brand $10-20 checkout aisle impulse buy speakers at electronics stores? These are those, but hugely marked up.
customer_reviews.author: OrangeFurious

customer_reviews.title: Bose makes a great product, it’s not cheap but you can always rely on the quality and service.
customer_reviews.text: The speakers have a great sound. I’ve had some issues with the volume and made adjustments both at the computer and speaker level. I’d like them to be a bit louder so that I could use them as home entertainment with some of the streaming services. They have a handy headphones jack right in front if you need some privacy or the rest of your family isn’t interested in hearing what you were listening to. Bose makes a great product, it’s not cheap but you can always rely on the quality and service.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Classical music sounds pretty darn good
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant based on some reviews but am glad I bought these. Just plugged them in and tested with Mozart and Rachmaninov. Surprisingly good bass, good overall sound, no hiss or other noise. Piano, flute, strings sound clean and clear. I'm impressed by these small speakers. The plug to my iPod got a little loose and made bad noise but once inserted strongly the noise disappeared. My 5-star rating takes into account the small speaker size. Better ones are out there but these are affordable, fit into my space, and deliver big sound.
customer_reviews.author: Cecelia

customer_reviews.title: Great Frequency Response
customer_reviews.text: I measured the frequency response of these speakers in my listening environment using Room EQ Wizard and a B&K 4007 mic which was recently calibrated at B&K's Denmark lab. These speakers are surprisingly flat out to 20 kHz, save for a minor dip around 40 Hz which is easily remedied with Equalizer APO on Windows. They are the best $100 I ever spent on speakers and are now my main monitors. Even without equalization, 40 Hz is awfully low so you might not notice the dip.
customer_reviews.author: chris319

customer_reviews.title: Great little speakers
customer_reviews.text: This is the third iteration of this speaker I have owned. The first set finally died after more than ten years. I currently have an older generation of this speaker for a computer speaker and I have this pair as a dedicated iPod speaker. The sound is very good up to a reasonable sound level. They are of a small enough size that I can easily move them from the kitchen to the garage or wherever I decide to use them. Bose continues to make a good sounding speaker and a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly R. Short

customer_reviews.title: DEEP TONE
customer_reviews.text: These bose speakers have a nice, deep tone. Can def tell the difference between these and a pair of LG speakers I replaced (started to crackle). One disappointment is that the audio cord was not long enough. It is only 3' so if your attaching to a PC, et al, a considerable distance away, you may also need to buy an additional cord that is sufficiently longer.
customer_reviews.author: Monti

customer_reviews.title: Not perfection, but I wasn't expecting perfection anyway
customer_reviews.text: Speakers are a decent value, but the sound quality isn't the best. I've had to boost the treble and high mid range on my music players to get a good sound out of them, and at times the bass is too boomy for my tastes. The cord between the two speakers is also pretty short, making it a little hard to place them far apart for good sound spread. Still, I wasn't expecting perfection from such an inexpensive set of speakers, and for my Zoom meetings and such, they're just fine.
customer_reviews.author: KieferSkunk

customer_reviews.title: Is it even Bose?
customer_reviews.text: My chin hit the ground after plugging these in. As an audiophile, I expected somewhat of sound separation for the price and make. But the sound is muffled, no clarity at all to the low end no clean highs. It sounds very compressed like a transistor radio. My partner unplugs them and just uses the build ins. I can't believe this god awefull cheap sound is Bose. I'd return them, but I'm homebound from an accident. I sure hope this isnt a sign of Bose future quality and quality control. My most disappointing buy in decades. Going to donate this junk to a local school.
customer_reviews.author: denise dube

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a smaller room
customer_reviews.text: When I first tried these speakers on my TV in my living room, I was disappointed. The sound quality was not terrible but it did not improve on the cheaper, older speakers that I was using. I then hooked the speakers up to a projector in a smaller room and I was very impressed with the sound quality. Essentially that was the goal when I placed the order. These speakers are not intended to take the place of a home theater system as they can cost upwards of $500. However they are a nice compliment to a computer, projector or TV in a smaller space.
customer_reviews.author: jarhead76

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time and money on anything else.
customer_reviews.text: I'm absolutely stunned at the sound these produce. Clean, spacious. I've tried *several* Logitech and other desktop speakers. They all sound hollow and tinny - something you might expect in this form factor. The Bose deliver deep rich bass - and enveloping sound. They have a reasonable footprint on the desk and low-profile, clean black finish. The sound is enough to easily fill a room - and these could even be used in a studio apartment environment - as mains on a TV or direct from a phone / iPod. Don't waste your time and money and frustration on anything else. Pony up the $100 and you will be pleased.
customer_reviews.author: jirby

customer_reviews.title: These speakers sound GREAT, BUT,  unless
customer_reviews.text: These speakers sound GREAT, BUT, unless your right speaker and the back of your CPU are within an easy three feet of each other, you WILL need to buy a longer "double male-ended connection cable" (or at least that's what I think they are called. ) than the one that comes with the speakers. (This is a product description of what I mean: "AmazonBasics 3.5mm Male to Male Stereo Audio Aux Cable - 8 Feet (2.4 Meters)"
customer_reviews.author: Denese S. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Very nice computer speakers
customer_reviews.text: These replaced a generic brand of amplified speakers that came with a computer from some years ago. The difference with the Bose speakers knocked my socks off. There is considerably more bass. The speakers are amazing for their small size. There is a pleasant feature that I haven't seen any other comments on. There is an input on the right hand speaker for another audio source to be plugged in. I used a cable to plug an Echo Dot into the right speaker. Thus, I can listen to Amazon Prime music, and any sounds from the computer also appear in normal fashion.
customer_reviews.author: Curmudgeon

customer_reviews.title: I love them. I am sure there are more affordable ...
customer_reviews.text: I was so hesitant to buy these.... price... do I really need such expensive speakers to just listen to music at my desk? I love them. I am sure there are more affordable options out there... but I was going for compact... and I didn't want a sep subwoofer as I find they are less effective at a wide range of volumes. Thats the beauty of Bose... everything just sounds about right... no messing with EQ or balance or Bass/Treb volume. My music sounds good... netflix sounds fine... Go to meetings work well. I am happy
customer_reviews.author: justme20

customer_reviews.title: Best pair of multimedia speakers so far.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been replacing average home theater systems with computer-intended speaker sets. I decided on these to use with a 50” TV to enhance the audio experience. I connected them using an RCA to male phono adapter from the TV’s audio out jacks. It was able to outperform and replace a traditional home theater setup. These take up very little space and pack a punch. The first thing I noticed was how full and rich the sound was. Great mid/low ends and crisp highs. The bass is definitely present. I was impressed with the sound quality for this price point. Worth it to give your TV audio some muscle.
customer_reviews.author: NickFromNJ

customer_reviews.title: Great price for what you are getting
customer_reviews.text: My Desk Top PC has arrived! Or, maybe I’ve arrived. Probably the PC.... As an old Audiologist I am kind of picky when it comes to sound. This will be my 5th Bose Product. I’ve procrastinated this purchase way to long. I’ve been using the same playlist for years with the occasional addition. I’m now motivated to start over! Seriously, these little speakers are acoustically amazing. I always wonder when Bose will start a hearing aid division. You are gonna like these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: MarcO

customer_reviews.title: Rather disappointed in them.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these speakers on May 12, 2015. They were more than adequate for my use (music, WoW, and watching shows/movies). However, over the past 4 months, they've begun working far less well. As of tonight, the left speaker isn't working at all, while the right speaker has to be turned all the way up to any shows/movies at normal speaking level. The right speaker still works for games and music, as long as the sound's turned a little over halfway up. I expected a Bose product to last longer than this, especially since I don't blast my music or games. :(
customer_reviews.author: Scath

customer_reviews.title: Great computer speakers, lousy shipping.
customer_reviews.text: Great speakers, very loud and clear, no complaints. The star off is for Amazon shipping it to me in the actual speaker box, no double packaging, nothing. I'm surprised that they weren't damaged or stolen, come on Amazon, you can do better with the packaging. Barring my annoyance above, the speakers are fantastic. The AUX jack in the back is great for my other computer and the headphone jack in front is very convenient. But hell, that shipping was the mold on the cheese.
customer_reviews.author: Griff

customer_reviews.title: lasted three months Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Bought in April, no longer working in August....lasted three months Don't waste your money...I would have given it O stars
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, you aren't going to break any windows with these speakers. That being said: If you wan't something that doesn't take up much space, looks good on your desk, delivers a COMPLETE spectrum of quality sound, this is your product. I haven't heard anything, on the market, of this size, that delivers this kind of realistic sound, especially, not without a sub woofer. For the price, as well, I would say you need to look no further than this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan S. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: NOT LOUD
customer_reviews.text: I read others reports on these speakers and they all said they are loud, MINE ARE NOT. I really like loud. My old silver companions were twice as loud as these and I am not very happy with them. Also I could hook alexa up to play through my old bose speakers. These just have a ONE input to them and only one to the computer which is why I think there is no big sound. The sound is nice, just not for me. I want to send them back I miss my sound!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl D. Meisel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: OMG, these ROCK!! Amazing in every way. Don't put up with wimpy "normal" PC speakers - pony up! At about $100, these will make your listening experience SO much better - for years! The PC-to-speaker cable is only about 24" long, so measure your requirement and buy a longer cable as needed. If you have a sophisticated sound card, be sure to adjust the settings for maximum performance. Have you ever experienced something that make you laugh in appreciation? A month later and I'm smiling ear to ear... Seriously amazing. The range will blow you away! And don't be afraid to crank 'em up - there's some serious volume available. DO IT!!
customer_reviews.author: Arf Will

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Sound
customer_reviews.text: Got them just today. Plugged them in and played a range of music, especially classical and classically influenced music with a lot of dynamic range. The sound is unbelievable. It's like being in the music hall as the music is played. Simply outstanding. Very full and broad sound for such small speakers. One minor 'plaint; no on/off indicator. No LED light. You just turn the knob and listen for the click. If you are into Hip/Hop/Rap and want the bass to reverberate through the foundation of you domicile, then add a sub-woofer.
customer_reviews.author: W_Parmantie

customer_reviews.title: Bose Companion 2 series III Multimedia Speakers installed on my HDTV
customer_reviews.text: I just installed these speakers on my HDTV, and they are outstanding. I have them in a 400 square foot room. The sound is outstanding! I am so impressed with them that I had to write my first ever review. They installed just like they would on my computer--very, very easily. I can't believe how amazing they are especially since they were not terribly expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Mtnart

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Purchase. Not Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: Just a week after purchasing the sound started glitching out, sounds comes out scratchy, even when playing at low volume. This is terrible. I really had high hope for this. Will be returning and looking else where. Trust me, you can get better quality for cheaper brand.
customer_reviews.author: Vinaka A.

customer_reviews.title: More than just Desktop Speakers...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because I play music through my iMac often through my Spotify App, so I was looking for more than just desktop speakers. The Bose Companion 2 Series III Multimedia Speakers are perfect for the size of the room. It has nice bass for speakers of this size and there's plenty of decibels packed in, so don't think that these little speakers can't hurt your ears, they can, so be careful if you're sitting close to your PC and stream multimedia using these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Subtle Defect in Sound, VERY BAD
customer_reviews.text: A few months after i purchased and had been using these speakers, the sound started messing up. The high notes are not playing as loudly; i can barely here the singing and vocals in songs. Also the overall sound is echoing or something, like the volume is getting louder and softer on its own. The wires are finicky. If i barely move the speaker while music is playing then it looses connection. Very disappointing because they sounded great for the 4 months that they worked properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: That Sound Quality only Bose Brings
customer_reviews.text: I had read several reviews saying these speakers are garbage and just as good as a pair of Logitech $20.00 speakers. NOT TRUE. These speakers are such a upgrade. Crystal clear crisp sound quality, aesthetically beautiful to look at, and you can also crank up the tunes quite loud. What a upgrade from my actual "$20.00 Logitech speakers". Those Logitech speakers are ok, but these Bose speakers are way, way, way better. I highly recommend. Ignore the nay sayers. They probably don't know how to computer, hooked it up wrong, or are hearing impaired.
customer_reviews.author: Red Hare

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like Bose Companion 2
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Bose Companion 2's for computer use. I have gotten my full value out of the first 2 pairs I have used. I have been using the Companion 2's for a couple of decades. I intend to convert my last pair for another purpose which mean they still work. For the first time my neighbor said he could hear my music from the apartment next door because of the rich bass on the Bose. That is a testimonial of its own.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Remy

customer_reviews.title: Big Bose Fan Says, "Buy 'Em!"
customer_reviews.text: I've been rockin' out to Bose since the mid-1980's and I've had all variety of their speakers (from bookshelf speakers, to battery-powered portable speakers, to outdoor speakers, to home theater speakers, and three versions of desktop computer speakers). This latest iteration of their computer speakers is great, and they sound noticeably better than the last generation. I wish they still came in grey (or white), but oh well. The black looks fine. At their current price, they are a steal for this level of sound quality. Buy them. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Willie V. HughesTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Speakers! Worth a few extra $.
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are well worth the $100. It seems like a lot for computer speakers, but these are very high quality, the sound is amazing, fills the room, and is very well balanced in the center. We use it mostly for music, could go cheaper if you are just conference calling. My only complaint is the extra plastic packaging. They could use recycled paper, there was a ton of waste to throw out.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Lightfoote

customer_reviews.title: Typical excellent Bose sound
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these with some misgiving, as I'd had three Bose Mini Soundlink units, all of which gave up the ghost with power/battery charging issues. They were not inexpensive and it was annoying. My notion here is I have the Bose sound quality comes with AC power, so I may have pulled a prime vulnerability out out the Bose small speaker products? Very good design and size for a desktop, and one doesn't have to go to MIT to install.
customer_reviews.author: CHN

customer_reviews.title: No easy way to extend distance between speakers (custom connection). Too much bass.
customer_reviews.text: There are two things I dislike about these speakers. The distance between the speakers is too short, and they use a custom connection so it is not an option to just buy a cord to increase the length (supposedly they make one, but the bose site comes up empty when I search for it). Too much bass with no easy way to decrease it. Not everyone likes strong bass. Otherwise they are fine, but I am still needing to buy a different brand of speaker to meet my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Keeney

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I've been a fan of Bose speakers for many years. I generally listen to music from my laptop, so it was very important to me that I purchase speakers of the highest sound quality; accordingly, I chose Bose. I was not disappointed - the sound is full, rich and clear. There is no distortion at the high end, regardless of how high the sound is. At $99.99, these were a tad expensive, but well worth the price. I would recommend these Bose speakers to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bryner

customer_reviews.title: Buy a set...you definitely won't be disappointed...much better sound than the speakers I had before...and they are relatively in
customer_reviews.text: on my mac I use a submarine sound...with my old speakers, I didn't realize the sound actually had that much depth to it..now I can hear everything on my Mac !!! These are very NICE speakers...over all they are simple and simple to use...but the sound and depth of the sound is VERY good. I cranked-up the volume one day and these things can really pump out the sound... Buy a set...you definitely won't be disappointed...much better sound than the speakers I had before...and they are relatively inexpensive too ! :)
customer_reviews.author: Fly Fishing the World

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product but missing item
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box, it was opened/used before because the packing was sloppy and one cable was missing - only an empty plastic bag still inside. Disappointed of course. Using my own cable, I set it up! This speaker is excellent for this price. Easy to set up and the sound is great. If I want more base, I turned it all the way up on speaker and using my PC to control the volume. I tried listen to classical music - not bad at all.
customer_reviews.author: mo

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, crisp sound for iMac at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought an iMac 27 5k and love it but found the sound was lacking. However, since I had just made the investment of an iMac, I didn't want to completely break the bank. I wanted the best system I could find under $150. After reading several reviews and doing research for a couple of weeks I finally decided to go with Bose and I couldn't be happier. The speaker sound is very robust and remains crisp, clear and distortion free no matter how high the volume. Installation was simple and now my home office workstation is perfect, all at a great price. Thank you Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Jason McLellan

product_meta.title: Bose Companion 2 Series III Multimedia Speakers - for PC (with 3.5mm AUX & PC input)
product_meta.description: Do you love playing music, games and videos on your computer? Wait until you try it with the Bose Companion 2 Series III multimedia speaker system. You'll enjoy performance that's significantly better than your original speakers, and it's the most affordable computer speaker system from Bose. You can access a world of entertainment on your computer. Bose engineering makes sure you hear it all with just two compact, elegant speakers. Unique digital signal processing produces clear, full sound at any volume. So you'll enjoy your favorite music, videos and streaming content even more than before. Sit down at your computer or laptop and get ready to hear sound that seems to extend far beyond the actual speakers. It's spacious and lifelike, made possible by TrueSpace stereo digital processing circuitry. Don't just play music, games and videos feel them. You'll notice deeper low end performance and more detailed sound, thanks to the speakers' ported cabinet design. Everything you need is in the box, and you can start enjoying better sound in minutes. Volume control and headphone jack are on the right speaker. Use the auxiliary input to bring Bose performance to another audio source such as your iPhone or iPad. Upgrade your sound and your experience with Bose Companion 2 Series III speakers.
feature_bullets: High quality audio performance, with clear sound at any volume. Use the auxiliary input to bring Bose performance to another audio source such as your iPhone or iPad. Upgrade your sound and your experience with Bose Companion 2 Series III speakers
High quality audio performance, with clear sound at any volume
Play an additional device just connect to the auxiliary input
Volume control/headphone jack on front of right speaker
